c:complexType.name: TreemapChart
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation class of the Treemap chart.
Treemap charts display hierarchical data using nested rectangles. They excel in revealing the location of valuable areas buried in a deep hierarchy.
The root data node is represented by the root rectangle, which occupies the whole plot area.
The area of a leaf node is proportional to the percentage of the size dimension over its sibling nodes. The area of a non-leaf node is the sum of the areas of its child nodes. If no size dimension is specified, then all sibling-leaf nodes will have identical areas.
Rectangles are usually colored so that siblings have the same color. This way, it is easy to identify sibling nodes and compare their relative sizes. In this way, the colors that are shown are the colors of leaf nodes' parents.

c:property.name: categoryRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The category visual role allows grouping data points to form a hierarchy.
The category visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the category prefix.
The visual role is required ad discrete.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: colorRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The color visual role controls the color of visual elements.
The color visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the color prefix or, if none exists, the dimensions of the "category" role.
The color visual role is optional and discrete.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: sizeRole
c:property.c:documentation:
The size visual role controls the relative area of sibling-leaf rectangles.
The size visual role automatically binds to a single dimension whose name has the size prefix.
The size visual role is optional and numeric.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: color
c:property.c:documentation:
The first color axis options.
This axis can also be accessed by the property name color.
See for more information on the way that the color axes' properties may be accessed.

c:property.name: sizeAxis
c:property.c:documentation: The size axis options.

c:property.name: treemap
c:property.c:documentation: The treemap plot is the main plot of the treemap chart, which means that its properties may be used without the "treemap" property suffix.

c:property.name: timeSeries
c:property.c:documentation: This chart type does not support this property.

c:property.name: timeSeriesFormat
c:property.c:documentation: This chart type does not support this property.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: TreemapChartExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the treemap chart type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
extension property (ex: smallBase)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: smallBase_strokeStyle (see ).

c:complexType.name: TreemapPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Treemap plot.

c:property.name: valuesAnchor
c:property.c:documentation: The treemap's value label is always anchored to the center of the associated rectangle.

c:property.name: valuesVisible
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.

c:property.name: valuesOptimizeLegibility
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if legibility of value labels should be optimized.
The current algorithm varies the text color so that it has enough contrast for the known background color.
It is applied only when a value label is considered to be inside its associated rectangle. Presently, it is considered to be inside, if the center point of the label is within the bounds of the rectangle.

c:property.name: valuesOverflow
c:property.c:documentation:
The behavior to apply when the text of a value label does not fit within the bounds of its associated rectangle.
This option applies only when is true.
Moreover, it also applies only for certain configurations of value label placement, relative to the associated rectangle. Presently, the supported placements are:
non-negative text margin, .
horizontal or vertical text â€” Text is horizontal when
is such that sin(textAngle) = 0 (example: 0). Text is vertical when
is such that cos(textAngle) = 0 (example: Math.PI/2, -Math.PI/2, 3*Math.PI/2, ...).
When an unsupported placement occurs, the label is shown.
Note that for the purposes of hiding and trimming, the value of is used for more that the distance between the anchor points of the label and the rectangle.
It is included as a required margin in all of the sides of the label.

c:property.name: layoutMode
c:property.c:documentation: The rectangle layout algorithm.

c:property.name: colorMode
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if the color is assigned to parent nodes or to leaf nodes.

c:property.name: rootCategoryLabel
c:property.c:documentation: The label that is used for the root node. The root node's label not always shows up to the user. It depends on the used and of the existence of a first-level leaf node.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for various visual elements of the chart.

c:complexType.name: TreemapPlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the treemap plot type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: treemap)
extension property (ex: leaf)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: treemapLeaf_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the treemap plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as leaf_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: leaf
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the leaf rectangles.

c:property.name: ascendant
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the non-leaf rectangles.

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the value label mark.
